title.narrative: 1.13 NUTRITION POLICIES/BUDGET DECISIONS

description.narrative: By 2017, public duty bearers at national, provincial and district levels are making evidence based policy and budget decisions about health and nutrition services that benefit the most disadvantaged children and women., which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the most disadvantaged children and women are accessing an integrated package of high impact, good quality health and nutrition services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, public duty bearers at national, provincial and district levels are making evidence based policy and budget decisionsabout health and nutrition services that benefit the most disadvantaged children and women.

description.narrative: KP SUN unit developed nutrition markers for financial planning of public sector development. A budgetary analysis of public sector development funds for nutrition was completed in Balochistan. MoNHSR&C adapted NMIS for real time programmatic data collection and informed decision-making. These activities have helped create an enabling environment for nutrition interventions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of Provincial/Area Governments that have developed and implement intersectoral nutrition strategies and plans to address malnutrition among the mothers and most disadvantaged children (RAM - CCPD)

actual.value: 2017:On TrackImplementation of multi-sectoral nutrition strategy in KP and Balochistan. UNICEF technical support was provided for a multi-sectoral project for districts Naushki and Pishin in Balochistan. Multiple sectors will be engaged to improve nutrition.Drafted a Nutrition Strategy for FATA, ap

title.narrative: SUN units established at P&DD KP, FATA , AJK and GB

actual.value: 2017:SUN units are functional in PAK, GB, KP and FATA with UNICEF financial and technical support. While technical support with limited scope is also provided to SUN units of other provinces, such as the multi-sectorial nutrition center in Punjab. title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) National management information system that includes disaggregated (age, sex, urbal/rural) data on nutrition available

actual.value: 2017:On TrackOnline NMIS, was finalized and is functional in KP & FATA with routine real time data available. Adoption of the online NMIS for PC-1 is under discussion in all provinces and regions. ToT training for online NMIS was conducted in KP/FATA, Balochistan and Sindh in 2017. A total of 145 t
